name: Elacestrant
mechanism: Binds to estrogen receptors causing degradation

precautions: Monitor for liver toxicity and cardiovascular effects

summary: Elacestrant is a selective estrogen receptor degrader (SERD) used in ER-positive, HER2-negative, ESR1-mutated advanced breast cancer.

specialConsiderations.pregnancy: Contraindicated due to risk of fetal harm
specialConsiderations.nausea_management: Nausea is common and may require antiemetic support

name: Enfortumab Vedotin
mechanism: Targets Nectin-4 and delivers a microtubule-disrupting agent

dosing.standard: 1.25 mg/kg IV on days 1, 8, and 15 of a 28-day cycle

summary: Enfortumab vedotin is an antibody-drug conjugate targeting Nectin-4, approved for locally advanced or metastatic urothelial cancer.
blackBoxWarning: Can cause severe skin reactions including Stevens-Johnson syndrome. Monitor closely.

specialConsiderations.skin_reactions: Monitor for signs of rash or mucosal involvement

name: Ruxolitinib
mechanism: Inhibits Janus-associated kinases 1 and 2 (JAK1 and JAK2), reducing cytokine-mediated inflammation
administration: Oral tablet, take with or without food

dosing.standard: 15–20 mg orally twice daily depending on platelet count

precautions: Adjust dose based on platelet count

summary: Ruxolitinib is a JAK1/JAK2 inhibitor used for myelofibrosis and polycythemia vera.

specialConsiderations.myelosuppression: Dose adjustments required for anemia and thrombocytopenia

name: Vincristine
mechanism: Inhibits microtubule formation, arresting cells in metaphase
summary: Vincristine is a vinca alkaloid mitotic inhibitor that blocks microtubule formation during mitosis. It is used in leukemias, lymphomas, and pediatric solid tumors.
blackBoxWarning: For intravenous use only – fatal if given intrathecally.

specialConsiderations.extravasation: Can cause severe local tissue damage
specialConsiderations.neurotoxicity: Peripheral neuropathy is dose-limiting; manifests as areflexia, paresthesia, and constipation

name: Avelumab
mechanism: Blocks PD-L1 to restore anti-tumor T-cell activity

precautions: Monitor for infusion reactions and immune toxicity

summary: Avelumab is a PD-L1 immune checkpoint inhibitor used in Merkel cell carcinoma and urothelial carcinoma.

specialConsiderations.pregnancy: Avoid due to risk of immune-mediated fetal harm
specialConsiderations.immune_related_events: Monitor for colitis, hepatitis, endocrinopathies, and pneumonitis

name: Teclistamab
mechanism: Redirects T-cells to target BCMA-expressing cells

name: Pegfilgrastim
mechanism: Stimulates neutrophil production via G-CSF receptor activation

name: Ipilimumab
mechanism: Blocks CTLA-4 to enhance T-cell activation
summary: Ipilimumab is a CTLA-4 checkpoint inhibitor used in melanoma, renal cell carcinoma, and in combination with PD-1 inhibitors in various cancers.
blackBoxWarning: Can cause immune-mediated adverse reactions including enterocolitis, hepatitis, dermatitis, and endocrinopathies.

specialConsiderations.endocrinopathies: May be irreversible; monitor thyroid and adrenal function
specialConsiderations.autoimmune_toxicity: Requires corticosteroids or treatment interruption for immune-related events

name: Savolitinib
mechanism: Inhibits MET signaling in cancers with MET exon 14 skipping mutations

precautions: Monitor for liver toxicity and lung toxicity

name: Olaparib
mechanism: Inhibits PARP enzyme to promote DNA damage in BRCA-mutated cells
administration: Oral tablet, take with or without food
summary: Olaparib is an oral PARP inhibitor approved for BRCA-mutated ovarian, breast, pancreatic, and prostate cancers.

specialConsiderations.gi_toxicity: Nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea are common

name: Fulvestrant
mechanism: Binds to and degrades estrogen receptors
administration: IM injection into the buttocks, monthly

dosing.standard: 500 mg IM on days 1, 15, 29, then monthly

summary: Fulvestrant is a selective estrogen receptor degrader (SERD) used in hormone receptor–positive metastatic breast cancer, especially after progression on antiestrogens.

specialConsiderations.injection_site_pain: IM administration may cause pain and bleeding

name: Sorafenib
mechanism: Inhibits VEGFR, PDGFR, RAF kinases to block tumor angiogenesis and proliferation
administration: Oral tablet, take on an empty stomach
summary: Sorafenib is a multikinase inhibitor targeting VEGFR and RAF kinases, used primarily in advanced renal cell carcinoma, hepatocellular carcinoma, and differentiated thyroid cancer.

specialConsiderations.hypertension: Monitor blood pressure regularly and manage appropriately
specialConsiderations.hand_foot_syndrome: Common dermatologic toxicity; dose adjust if severe

name: Lisocabtagene Maraleucel
mechanism: Autologous anti-CD19 CAR-T cells for large B-cell lymphoma

name: Necitumumab
mechanism: Binds EGFR to inhibit ligand-induced receptor activation and downstream signaling

dosing.standard: 800 mg IV on days 1 and 8 of a 3-week cycle

precautions: Monitor for infusion reactions and electrolyte imbalances

name: Bintrafusp Alfa
mechanism: Bifunctional fusion protein targeting TGF-β and PD-L1 to block immune evasion
summary: Bintrafusp alfa is a bifunctional fusion protein targeting PD-L1 and TGF-β, studied in advanced cancers.

specialConsiderations.pregnancy: Avoid due to unknown fetal risk
specialConsiderations.immune_toxicities: Similar to checkpoint inhibitors; monitor for colitis, hepatitis, endocrinopathies

name: Pralsetinib
mechanism: Inhibits RET gene fusions and mutations in cancer cells
administration: Oral capsule, take on an empty stomach

precautions: Monitor for hypertension and liver toxicity

name: Belantamab Mafodotin
mechanism: Targets BCMA to deliver MMAF and induce apoptosis

name: Epacadostat
mechanism: Inhibits indoleamine 2,3-dioxygenase to enhance T-cell activity
administration: Oral tablet, take with or without food
summary: Epacadostat is an investigational IDO1 inhibitor evaluated in combination with checkpoint inhibitors in solid tumors.

specialConsiderations.pregnancy: Avoid due to investigational safety profile
specialConsiderations.limited_evidence: No FDA approval to date; studied mainly with pembrolizumab

routineMonitoring: Immunologic adverse events (if used with checkpoint blockade)

name: Darolutamide
mechanism: Inhibits androgen receptor signaling, blocking cancer cell growth

precautions: Monitor for hypertension and cardiovascular risk

name: Rucaparib
mechanism: Inhibits PARP enzymes involved in DNA repair
administration: Oral tablet, take with or without food

name: Cabazitaxel
mechanism: Stabilizes microtubules and inhibits mitosis
summary: Cabazitaxel is a second-generation taxane used in metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer post-docetaxel.
blackBoxWarning: Neutropenia and severe hypersensitivity reactions; requires premedication and monitoring.

name: Erlotinib
mechanism: Inhibits EGFR tyrosine kinase, blocking downstream signaling
administration: Oral tablet, take on an empty stomach

dosing.standard: 150 mg once daily for NSCLC; 100 mg once daily for Pancreatic Cancer

precautions: Monitor for rash and pulmonary toxicity

summary: Erlotinib is an EGFR tyrosine kinase inhibitor used in NSCLC and pancreatic cancer with EGFR mutations.

specialConsiderations.rash: Common and may correlate with efficacy; use emollients or topical steroids
specialConsiderations.interstitial_lung_disease: Rare but serious; monitor respiratory symptoms

name: Larotrectinib
mechanism: Inhibits TRK fusion proteins to prevent tumor growth
administration: Oral capsule, take with or without food

precautions: Monitor for neurotoxicity and liver dysfunction

summary: Larotrectinib is a selective TRK inhibitor indicated for solid tumors with NTRK gene fusions, regardless of tumor site.

specialConsiderations.neurotoxicity: Monitor for dizziness, ataxia, or cognitive changes

name: Capmatinib
mechanism: Targets MET mutations including exon 14 skipping
administration: Oral tablet, take with or without food
summary: Capmatinib is a selective MET inhibitor used in NSCLC with MET exon 14 skipping mutations.

specialConsiderations.pregnancy: Avoid due to potential fetal harm

name: Pazopanib
mechanism: Inhibits VEGFR, PDGFR, and other kinases involved in tumor angiogenesis
administration: Oral tablet, take on an empty stomach

precautions: Monitor liver enzymes and blood pressure regularly

summary: Pazopanib is a VEGFR tyrosine kinase inhibitor used for renal cell carcinoma and soft tissue sarcoma.
blackBoxWarning: Severe hepatotoxicity may occur; monitor LFTs before and during treatment.

specialConsiderations.hypertension: Common; monitor and treat as needed
specialConsiderations.hepatotoxicity: Regular LFTs required; discontinue if severe

name: Relatlimab
mechanism: Blocks LAG-3 to enhance T-cell activation and immune response against tumors

name: Talquetamab
mechanism: Redirects T-cells to target GPRC5D-expressing myeloma cells

precautions: Monitor for CRS and neurologic toxicity

name: Pemigatinib
mechanism: Blocks FGFR2 fusion proteins to inhibit tumor growth in cholangiocarcinoma
administration: Oral tablet, take with or without food

dosing.standard: 13.5 mg orally once daily for 2 weeks, then 1 week off

precautions: Monitor for ocular toxicity and hyperphosphatemia

name: Filgrastim
mechanism: Stimulates neutrophil production to reduce risk of neutropenia
summary: Filgrastim is a recombinant G-CSF used to stimulate neutrophil production in chemotherapy-induced neutropenia, bone marrow transplant, or chronic neutropenia.

specialConsiderations.bone_pain: Common side effect; managed with acetaminophen or NSAIDs
specialConsiderations.splenic_rupture: Rare but serious; monitor abdominal symptoms

name: Zoledronic Acid
mechanism: Inhibits bone resorption by osteoclasts to prevent skeletal-related events

name: Ivosidenib
mechanism: Inhibits mutated IDH1 enzyme, reducing 2-HG levels and promoting differentiation of leukemic cells
administration: Oral tablet, take with or without food

precautions: Monitor for differentiation syndrome and cardiac toxicity

summary: Ivosidenib is an oral IDH1 inhibitor used for IDH1-mutated acute myeloid leukemia (AML) and cholangiocarcinoma.
blackBoxWarning: Risk of differentiation syndrome requiring corticosteroids and supportive care.

name: Tazemetostat
mechanism: Inhibits EZH2 methyltransferase, altering gene expression in cancer cells
administration: Oral tablet, take with or without food

name: Enasidenib
mechanism: Inhibits mutant IDH2 enzyme to reduce 2-hydroxyglutarate and restore differentiation
administration: Oral tablet, take with or without food

precautions: Monitor for differentiation syndrome and liver toxicity

summary: Enasidenib is an IDH2 inhibitor used in relapsed or refractory acute myeloid leukemia (AML) with IDH2 mutation.
blackBoxWarning: Differentiation syndrome is a potentially fatal complication requiring prompt treatment with steroids.

specialConsiderations.hyperbilirubinemia: Common side effect due to UGT1A1 inhibition
specialConsiderations.differentiation_syndrome: Treat early with corticosteroids if suspected

name: Sipuleucel-T
mechanism: Activates patient's immune system against prostate cancer using antigen-presenting cells

name: Anastrozole
mechanism: Blocks estrogen production in postmenopausal women
summary: Anastrozole is an aromatase inhibitor used in postmenopausal women with hormone receptor-positive breast cancer.

specialConsiderations.bone_density: Can reduce bone mineral density; consider bisphosphonates

name: Lifileucel
mechanism: Uses expanded TILs to attack tumor cells post-lymphodepletion

dosing.standard: One-time IV infusion following lymphodepleting chemotherapy

summary: Lifileucel is an autologous tumor-infiltrating lymphocyte (TIL) therapy used for advanced melanoma after progression on checkpoint inhibitors.
blackBoxWarning: Risk of severe cytokine release syndrome (CRS) and immune-mediated adverse effects.

specialConsiderations.preconditioning_regimen: Patients must undergo lymphodepleting chemotherapy prior to TIL infusion

name: Sunitinib
mechanism: Inhibits VEGFR, PDGFR, KIT, FLT3, CSF‑1R, RET
administration: 50 mg orally once daily (4 weeks on, 2 weeks off)

dosing.standard: 50 mg PO daily; 4 weeks on, 2 weeks off

summary: Sunitinib is a multikinase inhibitor targeting VEGFR, PDGFR, and others. It is used in renal cell carcinoma, pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors, and GISTs.

specialConsiderations.cardiac_toxicity: Monitor for hypertension and signs of heart failure
specialConsiderations.thyroid_dysfunction: Can induce hypothyroidism; monitor thyroid function

name: Vorinostat
mechanism: Inhibits histone deacetylase to promote cell cycle arrest and apoptosis
summary: Vorinostat is a histone deacetylase (HDAC) inhibitor used to treat cutaneous T-cell lymphoma (CTCL).

specialConsiderations.myelosuppression: Can cause thrombocytopenia and neutropenia; monitor CBC

name: Axitinib
mechanism: Inhibits VEGFR‑1, ‑2, ‑3

name: Cobimetinib
mechanism: Inhibits MEK1 and MEK2 to disrupt MAPK signaling in cancer cells
administration: Oral tablet, take with or without food

dosing.standard: 60 mg orally once daily for 21 days, then 7 days off

precautions: Monitor for cardiotoxicity and eye toxicity

summary: Cobimetinib is a MEK inhibitor used in combination with vemurafenib for BRAF V600E/K-mutant metastatic melanoma.

specialConsiderations.cardiotoxicity: Monitor LVEF before and during therapy

name: Dabrafenib
mechanism: Inhibits BRAF V600E kinase to block tumor cell proliferation
administration: Oral capsule, take 1 hour before or 2 hours after meals

precautions: Monitor for fever and cardiac toxicity

summary: Dabrafenib is a BRAF V600E-mutant inhibitor used in melanoma, NSCLC, and other tumors with the mutation, often in combination with trametinib.

specialConsiderations.fever: Fever is common and may require dose hold or steroids
specialConsiderations.cardiomyopathy: Monitor LVEF if used with MEK inhibitor

name: Enzalutamide
mechanism: Inhibits androgen receptor nuclear translocation and DNA binding
administration: Oral capsule, take with or without food
summary: Enzalutamide is an androgen receptor inhibitor used in metastatic castration-resistant and non-metastatic prostate cancer.

specialConsiderations.seizure_risk: Avoid in patients with history of seizures

name: Letrozole
mechanism: Inhibits aromatase enzyme, reducing estrogen levels
administration: Oral tablet, take with or without food
summary: Letrozole is an aromatase inhibitor used in hormone receptor–positive breast cancer and ovulation induction in PCOS.

specialConsiderations.osteoporosis_risk: Use calcium and vitamin D supplementation; consider bone density monitoring

name: Paclitaxel
mechanism: Stabilizes microtubules and inhibits mitosis
administration: IV infusion over 3 hours; requires premedication
summary: Paclitaxel is a taxane chemotherapeutic agent that stabilizes microtubules, leading to mitotic arrest. Used in breast, ovarian, lung, and other cancers.

specialConsiderations.neuropathy: Peripheral neuropathy is common and dose-limiting
specialConsiderations.hypersensitivity: Premedication with corticosteroids and antihistamines is required due to risk of anaphylaxis

contraindications: Severe hypersensitivity to paclitaxel or Cremophor EL

name: Encorafenib
mechanism: Inhibits BRAF V600E kinase, blocking MAPK pathway
administration: Oral capsule, take with or without food
summary: Encorafenib is a selective BRAF V600E/K inhibitor used in combination with binimetinib for metastatic melanoma.

specialConsiderations.cardiotoxicity: May cause decreased LVEF or QT prolongation

name: Leuprolide
mechanism: Suppresses gonadotropin release to reduce testosterone and estrogen

dosing.standard: 7.5 mg monthly or depot every 3–6 months

summary: Leuprolide is a GnRH agonist used in prostate cancer, breast cancer, endometriosis, fibroids, and precocious puberty.

specialConsiderations.tumor_flare: Transient initial rise in testosterone/estrogen—use antiandrogens in prostate cancer

name: Nilotinib
mechanism: Inhibits BCR-ABL tyrosine kinase
summary: Nilotinib is a second-generation BCR-ABL tyrosine kinase inhibitor used primarily for chronic myeloid leukemia (CML).
blackBoxWarning: QT prolongation and sudden cardiac death. Monitor ECGs and electrolytes closely.

specialConsiderations.qt_prolongation: Avoid in patients with hypokalemia or hypomagnesemia; monitor ECG
specialConsiderations.metabolic_effects: Can increase blood glucose, lipase, and amylase levels

name: Neratinib
mechanism: Irreversibly inhibits HER2, HER4, and EGFR tyrosine kinases, blocking downstream signaling pathways
administration: Oral: 240 mg once daily with food for metastatic cancer; empty stomach for adjuvant therapy

dosing.renal_adjustment: No adjustment for mild-moderate; avoid in severe
dosing.hepatic_adjustment: Reduce to 80 mg in severe impairment

summary: Oral HER2/EGFR TKI for HER2+ breast cancer with mandatory antidiarrheal prophylaxis, notable for high-grade diarrhea requiring proactive management
blackBoxWarning: Boxed warning for severe diarrhea and hepatotoxicity

specialConsiderations.diarrhea_prophylaxis: Loperamide x56 days with dose escalation

name: Elotuzumab
mechanism: Targets SLAMF7 to activate NK cells and mediate cytotoxicity
summary: Elotuzumab is a monoclonal antibody targeting SLAMF7, used in combination therapy for multiple myeloma.

specialConsiderations.infection_risk: Monitor for herpes zoster; consider prophylaxis

name: Ixazomib
mechanism: Inhibits 20S proteasome, disrupting protein homeostasis in myeloma cells
administration: Oral capsule, take at least 1 hour before or 2 hours after food

dosing.standard: 4 mg orally on days 1, 8, and 15 of a 28-day cycle

summary: Ixazomib is an oral proteasome inhibitor used in combination for multiple myeloma after at least one prior therapy.

name: Sotorasib
mechanism: Specifically inhibits KRAS G12C mutant protein
administration: Oral tablet, take with or without food

name: Talazoparib
mechanism: Inhibits PARP enzymes involved in DNA repair
administration: Oral capsule, take with or without food

name: Tisagenlecleucel
mechanism: Genetically modified T cells target CD19 on cancer cells
summary: Tisagenlecleucel is an autologous anti-CD19 CAR T-cell therapy used for relapsed/refractory B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia and diffuse large B-cell lymphoma.
blackBoxWarning: Risk of life-threatening cytokine release syndrome (CRS) and neurologic toxicities.

specialConsiderations.neurotoxicity: Monitor for confusion, aphasia, or seizures; may require corticosteroids
specialConsiderations.crs_monitoring: Hospitalize and monitor closely post-infusion; tocilizumab indicated for severe CRS

name: Erdafitinib
mechanism: Inhibits FGFR1-4 to block growth of FGFR-mutant tumors
administration: Oral tablet, take with or without food
summary: Erdafitinib is an FGFR inhibitor used for FGFR-mutated urothelial carcinoma.

specialConsiderations.ocular_toxicity: Can cause central serous retinopathy (CSR); regular eye exams required
specialConsiderations.hyperphosphatemia: Common and may require phosphate binders or dose adjustment

preTreatmentTests: Baseline phosphate level and eye exam

name: Venetoclax
mechanism: Inhibits BCL-2 to promote apoptosis in CLL/AML

name: Lenalidomide
mechanism: Enhances immune activity and inhibits angiogenesis
administration: Oral capsule, take at same time daily
summary: Lenalidomide is an immunomodulatory drug used in multiple myeloma, myelodysplastic syndrome (especially with 5q deletion), and mantle cell lymphoma.
blackBoxWarning: Risk of embryo-fetal toxicity, venous thromboembolism, and hematologic toxicity.

specialConsiderations.teratogenicity: REMS program required; strict contraception rules apply
specialConsiderations.myelosuppression: Monitor CBC regularly; dose adjust as needed

name: Nilotinib
mechanism: Inhibits BCR-ABL tyrosine kinase
summary: Nilotinib is a second-generation BCR-ABL tyrosine kinase inhibitor used primarily for chronic myeloid leukemia (CML).
blackBoxWarning: QT prolongation and sudden cardiac death. Monitor ECGs and electrolytes closely.

specialConsiderations.qt_prolongation: Avoid in patients with hypokalemia or hypomagnesemia; monitor ECG
specialConsiderations.metabolic_effects: Can increase blood glucose, lipase, and amylase levels

name: Tamoxifen
mechanism: Blocks estrogen receptors in breast tissue
administration: Oral administration; take with or without food
summary: Tamoxifen is a selective estrogen receptor modulator (SERM) used in ER-positive breast cancer. It acts as an antagonist in breast tissue and agonist in uterus and bone.
blackBoxWarning: Increased risk of endometrial cancer and thromboembolic events.

specialConsiderations.thromboembolism: Avoid in patients with history of VTE unless benefit outweighs risk
specialConsiderations.endometrial_risk: Monitor for abnormal uterine bleeding; endometrial surveillance if indicated

name: Gilteritinib
mechanism: Inhibits FLT3-ITD and FLT3-TKD mutants

name: Ibrutinib
mechanism: Inhibits Bruton’s tyrosine kinase
summary: Ibrutinib is a Bruton tyrosine kinase (BTK) inhibitor used in chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL), mantle cell lymphoma, and Waldenström’s macroglobulinemia.

specialConsiderations.bleeding_risk: Inhibits platelet aggregation; use caution with anticoagulants

name: Ado-Trastuzumab Emtansine
mechanism: Combines HER2-targeted trastuzumab with DM1 cytotoxic agent
administration: IV infusion over 90 minutes (first), then 30 min
summary: Ado-trastuzumab emtansine (T-DM1) is an antibody-drug conjugate targeting HER2+ breast cancer, combining trastuzumab and the cytotoxic agent DM1.
blackBoxWarning: Hepatotoxicity, cardiac toxicity, and pulmonary toxicity have been reported. Monitor LFTs and LVEF.

specialConsiderations.cardiotoxicity: Monitor ejection fraction before and during therapy
specialConsiderations.hepatic_impairment: Can cause liver failure—monitor LFTs closely

pharmacokinetics.metabolism: Proteolytic degradation of DM1; trastuzumab component recycled

name: Bortezomib
mechanism: Inhibits 26S proteasome, disrupting protein degradation in cancer cells

dosing.standard: 1.3 mg/m² twice weekly for 2 weeks, then 10-day rest

summary: Bortezomib is a proteasome inhibitor used in multiple myeloma and mantle cell lymphoma.

specialConsiderations.neuropathy: Peripheral neuropathy is common and dose-limiting

name: Cetuximab
mechanism: Inhibits EGFR signaling to reduce tumor growth
administration: IV infusion (initial over 2 hours, then 1 hour)
summary: Cetuximab is a chimeric monoclonal antibody against EGFR, used in colorectal and head/neck cancers with wild-type KRAS.

specialConsiderations.pregnancy: Avoid due to fetal toxicity risk
specialConsiderations.KRAS_status: Only effective in tumors with wild-type KRAS
specialConsiderations.infusion_reactions: May require premedication; monitor during infusion

name: Infigratinib
mechanism: Inhibits FGFR1–3, used in FGFR2-fusion positive cancers
administration: Oral capsule, take on empty stomach

dosing.standard: 125 mg orally once daily for 21 days of a 28-day cycle

summary: Infigratinib is a selective FGFR1-3 inhibitor used for FGFR2-fusion cholangiocarcinoma and other FGFR-driven tumors.

specialConsiderations.ocular_toxicity: Central serous retinopathy risk; baseline and periodic ophthalmologic exams required
specialConsiderations.hyperphosphatemia: Manage with phosphate binders or dose modifications

name: Selinexor
mechanism: Inhibits exportin 1 (XPO1), leading to accumulation of tumor suppressor proteins in the nucleus

name: Zandelisib
mechanism: Targets PI3K delta isoform to reduce B-cell proliferation

dosing.standard: 60 mg once daily on an intermittent schedule

name: Temozolomide
mechanism: Alkylates/methylates DNA to induce apoptosis in tumor cells
administration: Oral capsule, take on an empty stomach

dosing.standard: 75 mg/m² daily during radiotherapy, then 150–200 mg/m² for 5 days every 28 days

summary: Temozolomide is an oral alkylating agent of the imidazotetrazine class used to treat glioblastoma and anaplastic astrocytoma.

specialConsiderations.myelosuppression: Monitor CBC; increased risk of neutropenia and thrombocytopenia
specialConsiderations.pneumocystis_pneumonia: Consider prophylaxis in patients receiving concurrent radiotherapy

name: Avapritinib
mechanism: Inhibits mutant KIT and PDGFRA kinases involved in gastrointestinal stromal tumors
administration: Oral tablet, take on an empty stomach
summary: Avapritinib is a selective KIT and PDGFRA inhibitor approved for gastrointestinal stromal tumors (GIST) with PDGFRA exon 18 mutations.

specialConsiderations.cns_effects: Can cause cognitive impairment or hallucinations

name: Mobocertinib
mechanism: Targets EGFR exon 20 insertion mutations in NSCLC
administration: Oral capsule, take on empty stomach

name: Lurbinectedin
mechanism: Inhibits transcription by binding DNA and disrupting repair pathways

name: Neratinib
mechanism: Irreversibly inhibits HER1, HER2, HER4 kinases
summary: Neratinib is an oral irreversible tyrosine kinase inhibitor targeting HER2, used for extended adjuvant treatment of HER2-positive breast cancer.

specialConsiderations.diarrhea: Common and severe; often requires antidiarrheal prophylaxis

name: Tucatinib
mechanism: Inhibits HER2 kinase selectively with less EGFR inhibition
administration: Oral tablet, take with or without food

name: Trametinib
mechanism: Inhibits MEK1/2 to block MAPK pathway in cancer cells
administration: Oral tablet, take on an empty stomach
summary: Trametinib is a MEK inhibitor used to treat BRAF V600-mutated metastatic melanoma, often in combination with BRAF inhibitors (e.g., dabrafenib).

specialConsiderations.cardiotoxicity: Monitor ejection fraction; discontinue if significant decline
specialConsiderations.dermatologic_toxicity: Monitor for skin toxicity including rash and acneiform eruptions

name: Asciminib
mechanism: STAMP inhibitor specifically targeting BCR-ABL1
administration: Oral tablet, take with or without food

dosing.standard: 40 mg twice daily or 80 mg once daily

summary: Asciminib is a STAMP inhibitor used in the treatment of chronic myeloid leukemia (CML) with T315I mutation.

specialConsiderations.pregnancy: Avoid due to potential fetal risk
specialConsiderations.QT_prolongation: Monitor ECG in patients with risk factors

contraindications: Concurrent use with strong CYP3A4 inducers

name: Belantamab Mafodotin
mechanism: Delivers cytotoxic agent to BCMA-expressing myeloma cells
summary: Belantamab mafodotin is an anti-BCMA antibody-drug conjugate used in relapsed/refractory multiple myeloma.
blackBoxWarning: Ocular toxicity (keratopathy) is common; requires ophthalmologic monitoring before and during treatment.

specialConsiderations.eye_toxicity: REMS program required; regular eye exams mandatory

name: Fedratinib
mechanism: Targets JAK2 to reduce myeloproliferation
summary: Fedratinib is a selective JAK2 inhibitor used to treat intermediate or high-risk primary or secondary myelofibrosis.
blackBoxWarning: Wernicke’s encephalopathy has occurred; thiamine levels must be monitored.

specialConsiderations.cytopenias: Monitor CBC for anemia and thrombocytopenia
specialConsiderations.wernicke_risk: Monitor thiamine before and during therapy

name: Ripretinib
mechanism: Switch-control tyrosine kinase inhibitor targeting KIT and PDGFRA
administration: Oral tablet, take with or without food

name: Niraparib
mechanism: Inhibits PARP enzymes to prevent tumor DNA repair
administration: Oral capsule, take with or without food
summary: Niraparib is a selective PARP1/PARP2 inhibitor used as maintenance therapy in ovarian cancer, particularly for BRCA-mutated or homologous recombination deficient (HRD) tumors.

specialConsiderations.myelosuppression: Monitor CBC; dose adjust for thrombocytopenia or anemia

name: Cemiplimab
mechanism: Blocks PD-1 receptor, restoring T-cell activity against cancer
summary: Cemiplimab is a PD-1 immune checkpoint inhibitor approved for advanced cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma and other tumors.

specialConsiderations.immune_reactions: Risk of colitis, pneumonitis, hepatitis, endocrinopathies

name: Obinutuzumab
mechanism: Binds CD20 to induce enhanced ADCC
administration: 1000 mg IV on days 1, 8, 15 of cycle 1, then day 1 of subsequent cycles

dosing.standard: 1000 mg IV (days 1, 8, 15) then day 1 of each 28‑day cycle

summary: Obinutuzumab is a glycoengineered type II anti-CD20 monoclonal antibody used in chronic lymphocytic leukemia and follicular lymphoma.

specialConsiderations.infections: Monitor for neutropenia and reactivation of hepatitis B

name: Sacituzumab Govitecan
mechanism: Targets Trop-2 on tumor cells to deliver the active metabolite SN-38, causing DNA damage and cell death

dosing.standard: 10 mg/kg IV on days 1 and 8 of a 21-day cycle

precautions: Monitor for severe diarrhea and neutropenia

name: Margetuximab
mechanism: Fc‑engineered anti-HER2 antibody enhancing ADCC

name: Palbociclib
mechanism: Inhibits cyclin‑dependent kinases 4 and 6 to block cell cycle progression in cancer cells
administration: Oral tablet, take with or without food

dosing.standard: 125 mg orally once daily for 21 days, then 7 days off

precautions: Monitor for neutropenia and lung toxicity

summary: Palbociclib is a selective CDK4/6 inhibitor used for hormone receptor–positive, HER2-negative advanced breast cancer in combination with endocrine therapy.

specialConsiderations.neutropenia: Most common toxicity; requires frequent CBC monitoring
specialConsiderations.pulmonary_toxicity: Rare but serious interstitial lung disease reported

name: Ribociclib
mechanism: Inhibits cyclin-dependent kinases 4 and 6 to block cell cycle progression in cancer cells
administration: Oral tablet, take with or without food

dosing.standard: 600 mg orally once daily for 21 days, then 7 days off

precautions: Monitor for QT prolongation and liver toxicity

name: AMG 757
mechanism: Bispecific engager targeting DLL3 on tumor cells and CD3 on T‑cells to induce cytotoxicity

name: AMG 757 (tarlatamab)
classification: Bispecific T-cell Engager (BiTE) monoclonal antibody targeting DLL3
mechanism: Binds to delta-like ligand 3 (DLL3) on cancer cells and CD3 on T-cells, facilitating T-cell activation and tumor cell lysis.
administration: Intravenous infusion; dose escalation followed by maintenance dosing (e.g., every 2 weeks in clinical trials)

approved: Investigational use in relapsed/refractory small cell lung cancer (SCLC)
off_label: None (under clinical evaluation for other DLL3+ tumors)

dosing.standard: Dose-escalation phase followed by 10-100 mg every 2 weeks (varies by trial protocol)
dosing.hepatic_adjustment: No established guidelines; use caution in hepatic impairment

caution: CYP450 substrates (theoretical risk due to cytokine effects)

summary: Investigational BiTE antibody targeting DLL3 for SCLC, demonstrating T-cell mediated cytotoxicity with promising early efficacy but significant CRS risk requiring vigilant monitoring.
blackBoxWarning: Boxed warning for cytokine release syndrome (CRS) and neurologic toxicity in clinical trials

specialConsiderations.CRS_management: Tocilizumab protocol + ICU-level care for severe cases

name: Selpercatinib
mechanism: Selective RET inhibitor blocking oncogenic RET mutations
administration: Oral capsule, take with or without food

precautions: Monitor for hypertension and liver toxicity

name: Osimertinib
mechanism: Third-generation EGFR TKI targeting T790M mutation
administration: Oral tablet, take with or without food
summary: Osimertinib is a third-generation EGFR tyrosine kinase inhibitor used for NSCLC with EGFR exon 19 deletions or exon 21 L858R mutations and T790M resistance mutation.

specialConsiderations.qt_prolongation: Monitor ECG in patients with cardiac risk

name: Tiragolumab
mechanism: Anti-TIGIT monoclonal antibody to enhance T‑cell activation

name: Cyclophosphamide
mechanism: Cross-links DNA strands, leading to apoptosis

precautions: Ensure hydration to prevent hemorrhagic cystitis

summary: Cyclophosphamide is an alkylating agent used in hematologic malignancies and solid tumors. It is also used in autoimmune diseases.
blackBoxWarning: May cause hemorrhagic cystitis, bone marrow suppression, and secondary malignancies.

specialConsiderations.cystitis: Mesna or aggressive hydration recommended to prevent hemorrhagic cystitis
specialConsiderations.fertility: May cause infertility or gonadal suppression

pharmacokinetics.metabolism: Activated in liver via CYP2B6 to active alkylating metabolites

name: Doxorubicin
mechanism: Intercalates DNA and inhibits topoisomerase II
summary: Doxorubicin is an anthracycline antibiotic that intercalates DNA and inhibits topoisomerase II; used in breast cancer, lymphomas, and other solid tumors.
blackBoxWarning: Cardiotoxicity is dose-dependent and may lead to irreversible heart failure. Also causes severe myelosuppression and vesicant injury if extravasated.

specialConsiderations.cardiomyopathy: Assess LVEF prior to treatment and monitor cumulative dose
specialConsiderations.infusion_reaction: Red urine discoloration is common but harmless

name: Pertuzumab
mechanism: Binds HER2 to inhibit dimerization

dosing.standard: 840 mg IV loading, then 420 mg every 3 weeks

name: Imatinib
mechanism: Inhibits BCR-ABL, c-KIT, PDGFR kinases
summary: Imatinib is a tyrosine kinase inhibitor targeting BCR-ABL, c-KIT, and PDGFR, primarily used in chronic myeloid leukemia (CML), gastrointestinal stromal tumors (GIST), and other rare neoplasms.

specialConsiderations.fluid_retention: Monitor for edema and weight gain

name: Obinutuzumab
mechanism: Binds CD20 to induce enhanced ADCC
administration: 1 000 mg IV on days 1, 8, 15 of cycle 1, then day 1 of subsequent cycles

dosing.standard: 1000 mg IV (days 1, 8, 15) then day 1 of each 28‑day cycle

summary: Obinutuzumab is a glycoengineered type II anti-CD20 monoclonal antibody used in chronic lymphocytic leukemia and follicular lymphoma.

specialConsiderations.infections: Monitor for neutropenia and reactivation of hepatitis B

name: Ibrutinib
mechanism: Inhibits Bruton’s tyrosine kinase

name: Brentuximab Vedotin
mechanism: Targets CD30 to deliver MMAE and induce apoptosis
summary: Brentuximab vedotin is an anti-CD30 antibody-drug conjugate used in Hodgkin lymphoma and systemic anaplastic large cell lymphoma.
blackBoxWarning: Progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy (PML) has been reported.

specialConsiderations.pml_risk: Evaluate promptly if neurologic symptoms occur
specialConsiderations.neuropathy: Peripheral neuropathy is common and cumulative

pharmacokinetics.metabolism: Proteolytic degradation of the antibody; MMAE via CYP3A4/5

name: Gilteritinib
mechanism: Inhibits FLT3-ITD and FLT3-TKD mutants
summary: Gilteritinib is a FLT3 inhibitor indicated for relapsed or refractory FLT3-mutated acute myeloid leukemia (AML).
blackBoxWarning: Differentiation syndrome can occur and be life-threatening; prompt steroid therapy required.

name: Oxaliplatin
mechanism: Forms platinum-DNA adducts leading to apoptosis
administration: IV infusion over 2–6 hours; avoid cold exposure during infusion
summary: Oxaliplatin is a platinum-based alkylating agent used primarily in colorectal cancer and other solid tumors.

specialConsiderations.neuropathy: Acute cold-induced neuropathy is common; dose-limiting cumulative sensory neuropathy also occurs
specialConsiderations.hypersensitivity: Anaphylactic reactions can occur, especially after multiple doses

pharmacokinetics.half_life: Approx. 9–25 hours (terminal: up to 273 h due to tissue binding)

name: Margetuximab
mechanism: Fc‑engineered anti-HER2 antibody enhancing ADCC

name: Belantamab Mafodotin
mechanism: Targets BCMA to deliver MMAF and induce apoptosis

name: Trastuzumab
mechanism: Binds to HER2 receptor to inhibit proliferation of HER2-overexpressing tumor cells
administration: IV infusion; first dose over 90 minutes, reduce time if tolerated

dosing.standard: 8 mg/kg loading dose, then 6 mg/kg every 3 weeks

summary: Trastuzumab is a monoclonal antibody against the HER2/neu (ERBB2) receptor, used in HER2-positive breast and gastric cancer.
blackBoxWarning: Risk of cardiomyopathy and heart failure; baseline and follow-up echocardiography recommended.

specialConsiderations.cardiotoxicity: Dilated cardiomyopathy; do not combine with anthracyclines simultaneously
specialConsiderations.infusion_reactions: Common during first dose; monitor closely

contraindications: Known hypersensitivity to trastuzumab or components

name: Imatinib
mechanism: Inhibits BCR-ABL, c-KIT, PDGFR kinases

name: Dasatinib
mechanism: Inhibits BCR-ABL and SRC family kinases

name: Sunitinib
mechanism: Inhibits VEGFR, PDGFR, KIT, FLT3, CSF‑1R, RET
administration: 50 mg orally once daily (4 weeks on, 2 weeks off)

dosing.standard: 50 mg PO daily; 4 weeks on, 2 weeks off

summary: Sunitinib is a multikinase inhibitor targeting VEGFR, PDGFR, and others. It is used in renal cell carcinoma, pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors, and GISTs.

specialConsiderations.cardiac_toxicity: Monitor for hypertension and signs of heart failure
specialConsiderations.thyroid_dysfunction: Can induce hypothyroidism; monitor thyroid function

name: Vimseltinib
mechanism: Inhibits colony-stimulating factor 1 receptor (CSF1R) to reduce tumor-associated macrophages

conditions: Tenosynovial giant cell tumor (TGCT) where surgical resection would cause severe morbidity

name: Camidanlumab Tesirine
summary: Camidanlumab tesirine is an anti-CD25 antibody-drug conjugate investigated for relapsed/refractory Hodgkin lymphoma.

name: Vimseltinib
mechanism: Inhibits colony-stimulating factor 1 receptor (CSF1R) to reduce tumor-associated macrophages

conditions: Tenosynovial giant cell tumor (TGCT) where surgical resection would cause severe morbidity

name: Talquetamab
mechanism: Targets GPRC5D on multiple myeloma cells and CD3 on T-cells to induce cytotoxicity

conditions: Relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma after ≥4 prior therapies

name: Repotrectinib
mechanism: Inhibits ROS1 and NTRK kinases to prevent oncogenic signaling in fusion-positive cancers

dosing.standard: 160 mg orally once daily for 14 days, then 160 mg twice daily

name: Elranatamab
mechanism: Engages BCMA on myeloma cells and CD3 on T-cells to promote immune-mediated cytotoxicity

conditions: Relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma after ≥6 prior therapies

dosing.standard: 76 mg weekly for 6 doses, then 76 mg every 2 weeks

summary: Elranatamab is a BCMA-directed bispecific antibody for relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma.
blackBoxWarning: Cytokine release syndrome and immune effector cell-associated neurotoxicity are major concerns. REMS program applies.

specialConsiderations.crs_monitoring: Hospitalization and monitoring required after initial dose
specialConsiderations.neurologic_monitoring: Watch for signs of neurotoxicity, e.g., confusion or tremor

name: Abemaciclib
mechanism: Inhibits CDK4 and CDK6 to block cell cycle progression
summary: Abemaciclib is a selective CDK4/6 inhibitor used in HR+/HER2- breast cancer, typically in combination with endocrine therapy.
blackBoxWarning: May cause severe diarrhea, neutropenia, hepatotoxicity, and thromboembolic events. Monitor closely and adjust dose if needed.

specialConsiderations.pregnancy: Avoid during pregnancy due to potential fetal harm
specialConsiderations.hepatic_impairment: Dose adjustment may be needed in moderate to severe impairment

contraindications: Known hypersensitivity to abemaciclib or its components
routineMonitoring: Complete blood count (CBC) every 2 weeks for the first 2 months, then monthly

name: Dasatinib
mechanism: Inhibits BCR-ABL and SRC family kinases
summary: Dasatinib is a tyrosine kinase inhibitor used to treat Ph+ chronic myeloid leukemia (CML) and acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL).

specialConsiderations.pleural_effusion: Common and may require diuretics or steroids

name: Alpelisib
mechanism: Inhibits PI3Kα isoform in PIK3CA-mutant breast cancer
summary: Alpelisib is a PI3K-alpha inhibitor used in HR+/HER2-, PIK3CA-mutated breast cancer in combination with endocrine therapy.

specialConsiderations.pregnancy: Avoid use due to potential fetal harm
specialConsiderations.hyperglycemia: Common and may be severe—monitor fasting glucose regularly

name: Abiraterone Acetate
mechanism: Inhibits CYP17 to block androgen production
administration: Oral tablet, take on empty stomach + prednisone

dosing.standard: 1000 mg orally once daily + prednisone 5 mg twice daily

summary: Abiraterone acetate is an androgen biosynthesis inhibitor used in combination with prednisone for the treatment of metastatic prostate cancer.
blackBoxWarning: Risk of mineralocorticoid excess (e.g., hypertension, hypokalemia), hepatotoxicity, and adrenal insufficiency. Coadministration with glucocorticoids is essential.

specialConsiderations.pregnancy: Contraindicated in pregnancy. Male patients with female partners of reproductive potential should use effective contraception.
specialConsiderations.hepatic_impairment: Avoid in severe hepatic impairment (Child-Pugh C); monitor LFTs regularly

contraindications: Known hypersensitivity to abiraterone acetate or any excipients
routineMonitoring: Liver function tests (ALT, AST, bilirubin) prior to treatment and every 2 weeks for 3 months, then monthly
Serum potassium and blood pressure regularly during treatment

name: Alectinib
mechanism: Selective ALK inhibitor blocking ALK-mediated signaling

precautions: Monitor for liver toxicity and cardiac effects

summary: Alectinib is a highly selective ALK tyrosine kinase inhibitor used in ALK-positive non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC), particularly in metastatic settings.

specialConsiderations.pregnancy: Use effective contraception; fetal harm cannot be ruled out
specialConsiderations.cardiotoxicity: May cause bradycardia or QT prolongation
specialConsiderations.hepatic_impairment: Dose adjustment may be required in moderate to severe impairment

contraindications: Hypersensitivity to alectinib or any excipients
preTreatmentTests: ALK mutation status via genetic testing

name: Adagrasib
mechanism: Specifically inhibits KRAS G12C mutant protein to prevent cell proliferation
administration: Oral tablet, take with or without food

cancer_types: KRAS G12C-Mutant Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer

precautions: Monitor for cardiac toxicity and liver function

summary: Adagrasib is a KRAS G12C inhibitor used for non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with KRAS G12C mutations.

specialConsiderations.pregnancy: Avoid use in pregnancy; potential for fetal harm
specialConsiderations.hepatic_impairment: Use with caution; limited data available

contraindications: Hypersensitivity to adagrasib or formulation components

name: Panobinostat
mechanism: Inhibits histone deacetylases, leading to apoptosis of cancer cells

dosing.standard: 20 mg orally on days 1, 3, 5, 8, 10, 12 of a 21-day cycle

precautions: Monitor QT prolongation and blood counts

summary: Panobinostat is a histone deacetylase inhibitor used in relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma in combination with other agents.
blackBoxWarning: Severe diarrhea and cardiac toxicities including arrhythmias and ECG changes. QT prolongation requires close ECG monitoring.

specialConsiderations.diarrhea: May be severe and lead to dehydration and electrolyte imbalance
specialConsiderations.qt_prolongation: Baseline and periodic ECG monitoring required

name: Afatinib
mechanism: Blocks EGFR tyrosine kinase to inhibit tumor cell proliferation
administration: Oral tablet, take on an empty stomach

precautions: Monitor for severe diarrhea and skin toxicity

summary: Afatinib is a second-generation EGFR tyrosine kinase inhibitor used in EGFR-mutated NSCLC.

specialConsiderations.diarrhea: Frequent and potentially severe; early management is critical

name: AMG 757
mechanism: Binds DLL3 and CD3 to activate T-cells against small cell lung cancer
summary: AMG 757 is an investigational bispecific T-cell engager (BiTE) targeting DLL3 in small cell lung cancer and neuroendocrine tumors.

specialConsiderations.pregnancy: Avoid due to investigational status and unknown risks
specialConsiderations.cytokine_release_syndrome: Monitor for infusion-related reactions and cytokine storm

name: Amivantamab
mechanism: Targets EGFR and MET receptors to inhibit tumor growth

dosing.standard: 1050–1400 mg IV weekly for 4 weeks, then every 2 weeks

summary: Amivantamab is a bispecific EGFR-MET antibody used in non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with EGFR exon 20 insertion mutations.

specialConsiderations.pregnancy: Avoid due to potential fetal harm
specialConsiderations.infusion_reaction: High risk during first dose; premedicate and monitor

name: Atezolizumab
mechanism: Binds to PD-L1, blocking its interaction with PD-1 to restore T-cell activity
summary: Atezolizumab is a PD-L1 immune checkpoint inhibitor used in various cancers including NSCLC, urothelial carcinoma, and triple-negative breast cancer.

specialConsiderations.immune_reactions: Can cause immune-related adverse events (e.g., colitis, hepatitis, endocrinopathies)

name: Axicabtagene Ciloleucel
mechanism: Autologous anti-CD19 CAR-T cells for aggressive B-cell lymphomas
summary: Axicabtagene ciloleucel is a CD19-directed CAR T-cell therapy used for relapsed/refractory large B-cell lymphoma.
blackBoxWarning: Cytokine release syndrome (CRS) and neurotoxicity are serious risks. Treatment must occur in a certified facility.

specialConsiderations.CRS: Tocilizumab should be available before infusion; monitor for hypotension and fever
specialConsiderations.neurologic_events: May present as confusion, tremors, or seizures; monitor closely

pharmacokinetics.half_life: Not applicable – living cells expand in vivo

name: Axitinib
mechanism: Inhibits VEGFR‑1, ‑2, ‑3
summary: Axitinib is a VEGF receptor tyrosine kinase inhibitor used in advanced renal cell carcinoma.

specialConsiderations.bleeding: Use with caution in patients with risk of hemorrhage

name: Bevacizumab
mechanism: Binds VEGF to inhibit angiogenesis in tumors
summary: Bevacizumab is a monoclonal antibody against VEGF, used in solid tumors like colorectal, lung, renal, and glioblastoma.
blackBoxWarning: Risk of GI perforation, impaired wound healing, and serious bleeding events.

specialConsiderations.wound_healing: Hold therapy before major surgery and resume only after healing

name: Binimetinib
mechanism: Inhibits MEK1/2 to block downstream MAPK signaling
administration: Oral tablet, take with or without food

precautions: Monitor for visual and cardiac side effects

summary: Binimetinib is a MEK inhibitor used in combination with encorafenib for unresectable or metastatic melanoma with BRAF V600E or V600K mutations.

specialConsiderations.ocular_toxicity: Risk of retinal pigment epithelial detachment
specialConsiderations.cardiac_toxicity: Monitor LVEF before and during therapy

name: Blinatumomab
mechanism: Redirects T-cells to kill CD19-expressing leukemia cells

dosing.standard: 9 mcg/day continuous IV infusion for 7 days, then 28 mcg/day

summary: Blinatumomab is a bispecific CD19-directed CD3 T-cell engager (BiTE) used in B-cell precursor acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL).
blackBoxWarning: Cytokine release syndrome (CRS) and neurotoxicity are common and potentially fatal. Hospitalization required for first cycle.

specialConsiderations.CRS: Premedicate with dexamethasone; monitor for fever and hypotension

name: Brexucabtagene Autoleucel
mechanism: CD19-directed genetically modified T‑cell therapy
summary: Brexucabtagene autoleucel is an autologous CD19-directed CAR T-cell therapy used in mantle cell lymphoma and B-cell precursor ALL.
blackBoxWarning: Risk of cytokine release syndrome (CRS) and neurologic toxicities; requires REMS certification.

specialConsiderations.crs: Premedicate and monitor closely post-infusion; manage with tocilizumab as needed
specialConsiderations.neurotoxicity: Can cause confusion, tremors, or encephalopathy; requires neurologic monitoring

pharmacokinetics.half_life: Not applicable – genetically modified cells expand and persist in vivo

name: Brigatinib
mechanism: Inhibits ALK and ROS1 tyrosine kinases in lung cancer
administration: Oral tablet, take with or without food

dosing.standard: 90 mg once daily for 7 days, then increase to 180 mg daily

precautions: Monitor for pulmonary toxicity and hypertension

summary: Brigatinib is an ALK tyrosine kinase inhibitor used in ALK-positive non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC).

specialConsiderations.pulmonary_toxicity: Can occur within days of initiation; monitor for dyspnea and cough

name: Cabozantinib
mechanism: Inhibits MET, VEGFR, AXL, RET, ROS1
summary: Cabozantinib is a VEGFR tyrosine kinase inhibitor used in renal cell carcinoma and medullary thyroid carcinoma.

specialConsiderations.wound_healing: Hold before major surgery and delay restart until adequate healing

name: Regorafenib
mechanism: Inhibits multiple tyrosine kinases involved in tumor angiogenesis and oncogenesis
administration: Oral tablet, take on an empty stomach

dosing.standard: 160 mg orally once daily for 3 weeks on, 1 week off

summary: Regorafenib is a multi-kinase inhibitor targeting VEGFR, PDGFR, and other kinases, used in metastatic colorectal cancer, GIST, and hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC).

specialConsiderations.hepatotoxicity: Monitor LFTs closely; hepatotoxicity can be fatal
specialConsiderations.dermatologic_toxicity: Hand-foot skin reaction is common and may require dose adjustment

name: Capecitabine
mechanism: Oral prodrug converted to 5-FU in tumor cells to inhibit DNA synthesis
administration: Oral administration; take within 30 minutes after meals

dosing.standard: 1000–1250 mg/m² twice daily for 14 days every 21 days

summary: Capecitabine is an oral prodrug of 5-fluorouracil (5-FU), used in the treatment of colorectal, breast, and gastric cancers.

specialConsiderations.hand_foot_syndrome: Common adverse effect; may require dose modification

pharmacokinetics.metabolism: Converted to 5-FU in the liver and tumor tissue

name: Ponatinib
mechanism: Inhibits BCR-ABL including T315I mutation
administration: Oral tablet, take with or without food
summary: Ponatinib is a third-generation BCR-ABL tyrosine kinase inhibitor effective against T315I-mutant chronic myeloid leukemia (CML) and Ph+ acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL).
blackBoxWarning: Arterial occlusions, venous thromboembolism, and hepatotoxicity are serious risks. Use only in patients who have failed prior TKIs or have T315I mutation.

specialConsiderations.hepatotoxicity: Monitor LFTs frequently; may require dose interruption or reduction
specialConsiderations.vascular_events: Monitor for signs of arterial or venous thrombosis; manage cardiovascular risk factors

name: Ciltacabtagene Autoleucel
mechanism: Genetically modified autologous T cells targeting BCMA in myeloma cells
summary: Ciltacabtagene autoleucel is a BCMA-directed CAR T-cell therapy approved for relapsed/refractory multiple myeloma.
blackBoxWarning: Risk of cytokine release syndrome (CRS) and immune effector cell-associated neurotoxicity syndrome (ICANS).

specialConsiderations.crs: Monitor for fever, hypotension, hypoxia; requires tocilizumab availability
specialConsiderations.pregnancy: Avoid due to live cell therapy and unknown risks

name: Cisplatin
mechanism: Forms DNA crosslinks and inhibits DNA replication
summary: Cisplatin is a platinum-based chemotherapy agent that forms DNA cross-links, inhibiting DNA replication. It is used in various solid tumors including testicular, ovarian, bladder, and lung cancers.
blackBoxWarning: Severe nephrotoxicity, ototoxicity, and nausea/vomiting are dose-limiting. Requires aggressive hydration and monitoring.

specialConsiderations.hydration: Aggressive IV hydration and diuretics recommended to prevent nephrotoxicity

name: Darbepoetin Alfa
mechanism: Stimulates erythropoiesis by acting like erythropoietin

dosing.standard: 2.25 mcg/kg weekly or 500 mcg every 3 weeks

precautions: Discontinue if no response after 8 weeks

summary: Darbepoetin alfa is a long-acting erythropoiesis-stimulating agent used in anemia due to chemotherapy or chronic kidney disease.
blackBoxWarning: Increased risk of cardiovascular events, stroke, and tumor progression if used to target Hb > 11 g/dL.

specialConsiderations.iron_status: Ensure adequate iron before and during therapy
specialConsiderations.thromboembolism: Increased risk with higher hemoglobin targets

name: Datopotamab Deruxtecan
mechanism: Delivers a topoisomerase inhibitor to Trop‑2 expressing cells

precautions: Monitor for lung toxicity and neutropenia

summary: Datopotamab deruxtecan is an antibody-drug conjugate targeting TROP2, under investigation for use in solid tumors such as breast and lung cancer.

specialConsiderations.eye_toxicity: Conjunctivitis and keratitis reported in trials
specialConsiderations.ILD_pneumonitis: Monitor respiratory symptoms closely; may require corticosteroids

name: Denosumab
mechanism: Inhibits osteoclast activity via RANKL blockade
summary: Denosumab is a RANKL inhibitor used to prevent skeletal-related events in patients with bone metastases and to treat osteoporosis.

specialConsiderations.hypocalcemia: Risk increased in patients with renal impairment; supplement calcium and vitamin D
specialConsiderations.jaw_osteonecrosis: Avoid invasive dental procedures if possible

name: Rituximab
mechanism: Binds CD20 on B‑cells to induce ADCC and CDC
summary: Rituximab is a chimeric anti-CD20 monoclonal antibody used in B-cell non-Hodgkin lymphomas, chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL), and autoimmune conditions like rheumatoid arthritis.
blackBoxWarning: Risk of progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy (PML), infusion reactions, and hepatitis B reactivation.

specialConsiderations.infusion_reactions: Premedicate with corticosteroids and antihistamines; monitor closely during first infusion

name: Rituximab
mechanism: Binds CD20 on B‑cells to induce ADCC and CDC
summary: Rituximab is a chimeric anti-CD20 monoclonal antibody used in B-cell non-Hodgkin lymphomas, chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL), and autoimmune conditions like rheumatoid arthritis.
blackBoxWarning: Risk of progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy (PML), infusion reactions, and hepatitis B reactivation.

specialConsiderations.infusion_reactions: Premedicate with corticosteroids and antihistamines; monitor closely during first infusion

name: Neratinib
mechanism: Irreversibly inhibits HER2, HER4, and EGFR tyrosine kinases, blocking downstream signaling pathways
administration: Oral: 240 mg once daily with food for metastatic cancer; empty stomach for adjuvant therapy

dosing.renal_adjustment: No adjustment for mild-moderate; avoid in severe
dosing.hepatic_adjustment: Reduce to 80 mg in severe impairment

summary: Oral HER2/EGFR TKI for HER2+ breast cancer with mandatory antidiarrheal prophylaxis, notable for high-grade diarrhea requiring proactive management
blackBoxWarning: Boxed warning for severe diarrhea and hepatotoxicity

specialConsiderations.diarrhea_prophylaxis: Loperamide x56 days with dose escalation

name: Neratinib
mechanism: Irreversibly inhibits HER2, HER4, and EGFR tyrosine kinases, blocking downstream signaling pathways
administration: Oral: 240 mg once daily with food for metastatic cancer; empty stomach for adjuvant therapy

dosing.renal_adjustment: No adjustment for mild-moderate; avoid in severe
dosing.hepatic_adjustment: Reduce to 80 mg in severe impairment

summary: Oral HER2/EGFR TKI for HER2+ breast cancer with mandatory antidiarrheal prophylaxis, notable for high-grade diarrhea requiring proactive management
blackBoxWarning: Boxed warning for severe diarrhea and hepatotoxicity

specialConsiderations.diarrhea_prophylaxis: Loperamide x56 days with dose escalation

name: Nedaplatin
mechanism: Forms DNA intra- and inter-strand crosslinks, inhibiting DNA replication and transcription, leading to apoptosis in rapidly dividing tumor cells
administration: Intravenous infusion: 80–100 mg/m² over 1–2 hours every 3–4 weeks with pre- and post-hydration

dosing.renal_adjustment: Reduce dose if CrCl <60 mL/min; avoid if <40 mL/min

during_treatment: Renal function prior to each cycle

caution: Concurrent nephrotoxic agents (e.g., aminoglycosides, amphotericin B)
contraindicated: Live attenuated vaccines (e.g., MMR, varicella) during therapy

summary: Nedaplatin is a second-generation platinum analog developed to reduce nephrotoxicity compared to cisplatin. It retains similar efficacy and is mainly approved in Japan and China for esophageal and lung cancers, with regional use in head and neck malignancies. It is also being explored in gynecologic cancers. Requires hydration and close hematologic monitoring due to significant myelosuppression.

specialConsiderations.hydration: Pre- and post-hydration essential to minimize renal toxicity
specialConsiderations.myelosuppression_management: Dose delay or reduction based on nadir blood counts; use G-CSF as appropriate

name: Mosunetuzumab
mechanism: Engages CD3+ T-cells and CD20+ B-cells, triggering T-cell-mediated cytotoxicity and immune synapse formation
administration: IV step-up dosing: Day 1 (1 mg), Day 8 (2 mg), Day 15 (60 mg); subsequent cycles: 30–60 mg every 21 days

approved: Relapsed/refractory follicular lymphoma after ≥2 prior systemic therapies
off_label: Diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (DLBCL) under investigation in Phase III trials

dosing.standard: Cycle 1: Day 1 (1 mg), Day 8 (2 mg), Day 15 (60 mg); subsequent cycles: 30–60 mg Day 1 of each 21-day cycle
dosing.hepatic_adjustment: No data available — use with caution in hepatic dysfunction

during_treatment: Vital signs every 4–6 hours for ≥48h post-infusion during Cycle 1
CRS grading and intervention readiness (tocilizumab availability)
Neurologic checks daily for 10 days during initial cycle

caution: CYP450 substrate drugs — potential metabolic alteration during cytokine release
contraindicated: Concomitant use of immunosuppressants or CAR T-cell therapy

summary: Mosunetuzumab is the first-in-class CD20/CD3 bispecific antibody approved for relapsed follicular lymphoma. It activates T-cells to kill malignant B-cells and offers step-up dosing with the potential for outpatient administration. CRS is the key toxicity.
blackBoxWarning: Cytokine release syndrome (CRS) — monitor closely during initial cycles and have tocilizumab readily available.

specialConsiderations.CRS_management: Administer tocilizumab for grade ≥2 CRS; consider corticosteroids for persistent symptoms
specialConsiderations.neuro_monitoring: Daily neurologic exam during Cycle 1 and after CRS events
specialConsiderations.inpatient_monitoring: Hospitalize patients at high risk for severe CRS for initial step-up dosing

preTreatmentTests: CD20 expression confirmation via tumor biopsy
Baseline CRP and liver function tests

name: Lutetium-177 PSMA-617
mechanism: Binds prostate-specific membrane antigen (PSMA) on tumor cells and delivers cytotoxic β-radiation from Lutetium-177, inducing DNA damage and cell death
administration: Intravenous: 7.4 gigabecquerels (GBq) every 6 weeks for up to 6 total cycles

approved: PSMA-positive metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer (mCRPC) after androgen receptor pathway inhibition and taxane-based chemotherapy

dosing.standard: 7.4 GBq IV every 6 weeks x6 cycles

during_treatment: CBC weekly during first cycle, then monthly
Renal function prior to each cycle

summary: Lutetium-177 PSMA-617 (Pluvicto) is the first FDA-approved radioligand therapy targeting PSMA in advanced prostate cancer. It prolongs survival in PSMA+ mCRPC patients and delivers systemic β-radiation directly to tumor cells, requiring PSMA-PET confirmation before use.
blackBoxWarning: Radiation exposure risk — handle with proper radiopharmaceutical precautions and patient safety protocols

specialConsiderations.radiation_safety: Patients should follow 48-hour radiation hygiene precautions, including double flushing and avoiding close contact with young children or pregnant individuals
specialConsiderations.renal_precautions: Hydration before and after therapy is advised to reduce renal retention
specialConsiderations.imaging_requirement: PSMA-PET/CT scan is mandatory to confirm PSMA-positivity prior to therapy

routineMonitoring: Renal function prior to each cycle
